metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3266 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read can occur when decoding H264 video. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.3, Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3266` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
